_source.title: Barista
_source.description:
The ideal candidate is passionate, driven by customer satisfaction and takes pride in their work. Experience in the food industry is preferred but not a requirement. Barista experience (and willingness to learn) is a bonus for FOH candidate, training to our standards will also be provided.

Responsibilities include:

- Customer interaction - must have great communication skills!

- POS & cash handling

- Order taking & filling orders

- Maintain shop cleanliness at all times

- Knowledge and experience in coffee

- Adhere to health & safety standards

Candidate must:

- Be positive and have a great sense of humour & attitude

- 1 year minimum in hospitality industry with cash-handling experience & customer interaction

- Have excellent communication and problem solving skills

- Is able to work in a fast paced, fun, and team-oriented environment

- Available to work on weekends

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $14.00 to $16.00 /hour

Language:

  • English (Preferred)

_source.title: Barista
_source.description:
We need part time barista to CLOSE the Cafe in Downtown for a permanent position.

Will do the coffee, need to keep the station clean, restock the freezers, make Lattes, Cappuccinos, etc. Will be charge for the drinks and pastries too.

Experience needed.

Monday to Friday job.

Job Type: Part-time

Salary: $14.50 /hour

Language:

  • English (Preferred)

_source.title: Barista (827 St. Clair Ave W)
_source.description:
We are currently looking for an experienced barista for the What A Bagel Eatery location on St. Clair Ave. West. We are located at 827 St. Clair Avenue West (St. Clair/Oakwood). The ideal candidate must be friendly, outgoing, enthusiastic, hard working and practice safe food handling.

Operating hours are 7am-6pm M-F and 8am-5pm Sat-Sun

Currently looking to hire for Monday to Friday Shifts and weekends

Job starts immediately so please send us your resume

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Language:

  • English (Preferred)
  • French (Preferred)

_source.title: Full Time Starbucks Barista
_source.description:
Job Description

Job Type: Full time

Location: University of Toronto (Mississauga Campus) UTM

We Offer full denial and Health Benefit after 6 months of continuous employment

As a Starbucks Barista, you will create the Starbucks Experience for our customers by providing legendary customer service with prompt service, quality beverages and products, and maintaining a clean and comfortable store environment. You will be responsible for modeling and acting in accordance with Starbucks guiding principles and best of all, youâ€™ll be part of a company that is consistently rated as a great place to work and the people here love what they do.

Summary of Key Responsibilities:

Responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following:

  • Acts with integrity, honesty and knowledge that promote the culture, values and mission of Starbucks.
  • Maintains a calm demeanor during periods of high volume or unusual events to keep store operating to standard and to set a positive example for the shift team.
  • Anticipates customer and store needs by constantly evaluating environment and customers for cues.
  • Communicates information to manager so that the team can respond as necessary to create the Third Place environment during each shift.
  • Assists with new partner training by positively reinforcing successful performance and giving respectful and encouraging coaching as needed.
  • Contributes to positive team environment by recognizing alarms or changes in partner morale and performance and communicating them to the store manager.
  • Delivers legendary customer service to all customers by acting with a customer comes first attitude and connecting with the customer. Discovers and responds to customer needs.
  • Follows Starbucks operational policies and procedures, including those for cash handling and safety and security, to ensure the safety of all partners during each shift. Maintains a clean and organized workspace so that partners can locate resources and product as needed.
  • Maintains regular and consistent attendance and punctuality.
  • Provides quality beverages, whole bean, and food products consistently for all customers by adhering to all recipe and presentation standards. Follows health, safety and sanitation guidelines for all products.
  • Recognizes and reinforces individual and team accomplishments by using existing organizational methods.
  • Carefully enters all sales into the cash register to ensure that all purchases are accurately recorded.
  • Makes change, processes credit card transactions; checks for counterfeit bills as per Company policy where equipment is provided, and issues receipts to customers.
  • Follow standard procedures for issuing cash refunds.
  • Performs sales transactions in a reasonable and timely fashion.
  • May be required to assist any brand or Chartwells unit as required by the unit manager

Qualifications

Summary of Experience

  • No previous experience required

Required Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

  • Ability to learn quickly
  • Ability to understand and carry out oral and written instructions and request clarification when needed
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work as part of a team
  • Ability to build relationships Physical Requirements
  • Constant standing/walking
  • Occasional pushing, pulling, lifting or carrying up to 40 lbs
  • Occasional ascending or descending ladders, stairs, ramps
  • Constant computer/POS Register and bar equipment usage
  • Frequent, continual, intermittent flexing or rotation of the wrist(s) and spine
  • Constant reaching, turning, and performing precision work around bar area
  • Constant receiving detailed information through oral communication
  • Constant talking, expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word
  • Occasional Distinguishing, with a degree of accuracy, differences or similarities in intensity or quality of flavors and/or odors
  • Constant clarity of vision at near and/or far distances

Additional Information

Job Type: Full time

Location: University of Toronto (Mississauga Campus) UTM

We Offer full denial and Health Benefit after 6 months of continuous employment

Thank you for your interest in a career with Compass Group!


Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

We will consider your resume for additional opportunities.


Compass Group Canada is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive work environment where all employees are treated fairly and equitably which includes providing accommodation. Health, Safety, Environment and Quality (HSEQ) is also an operational priority. Safeguarding the health and safety of our people and customers is essential to the success of our business.


Learn more about us at www.compass-canada.com!
